intro: Drepananthus prunifer, commonly known as the fruit-bearing hookweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
